results.title: Youth and credit (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Geoff Scott presents a dramatised story of a young man who encounters a series of escalating problems with credit, relating to the purchase of a car. The film is then discussed with an invited audience of teenagers and ‘experts’ with the aim of introducing safe ways of handling credit. The video is accompanied by Teacher’s notes. Pt. 1. The forum. Pt. 2. Eddy: a trigger film.

results.title: Yours truly, Andrea G. Stern
results.brief_description: A ten year old struggles with the problem of sharing her mother with a boyfriend who has just moved into the house. The mother is completely at a loss as to what to do, as what seemed a fine idea to her at first quickly turns sour with resentment and jealousy. The resolution of this conflict is thoroughly realistic, and without a “happily ever after” ending.

results.title: Your very good health
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Charley”.
A cartoon illustrating various aspects of Britain’s National Health Service Scheme. Discusses in particular the effect of the scheme on the average British family.

results.title: Your study methods
results.brief_description: Effective study methods result from thinking about an asignment, considering its requirements and its purposes and working it through in a systematic way. As pupils apply these principles in a variety of study assignments, we learn the value of planning, organising, materials, note taking, and outlining.

results.title: Your skin
results.creator_credit: World Wide Animation, Unilever Films and Ric Wylam
results.brief_description: A combination of animation and photography is used to describe the skin and its functions in simple terms. Some surprising facts and figures are given. The parts of the skin are shown and its growth explained. The film shows clearly the importance of hygiene in helping the body to resist infection.

results.title: Your silent partner
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Dept. of Agriculture and O.J. Wrightson
results.brief_description: Outlines methods of fodder conservation on the dairy farm. The cow may be regarded as a milk factory and if food is in short supply or of the wrong type, milk production will be reduced. The composition of milk is used to illustrate the need for a balanced diet and how such a diet can be obtained from different types of fodder. The latter sections of the film illustrate methods of making grass silage and meadow hay to provide a reserve of fodder for use throughout the year.

results.title: Your richest gift
results.brief_description: A good industrial safety record is the result of co-operation between management and employees. Safety equipment and safe working habits are necessary to prevent accidents. To protect the eyes safety glasses or goggles should be worn at all times. Shows the safety procedures operating at the Owens-Illinois factory.
